definition: to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve

sentences.english: Many companies are ordering employees to take unpaid leave.
sentences.chinese: 许多公司让员工停薪留职。

sentences.english: The retention bonuses are structured as a loan and deferred cash paid over three years.
sentences.chinese: 这笔留职金将在未来三年以现金方式分批支付。

sentences.english: After they beat him up for four days he announced he would stay on.
sentences.chinese: 他们对他痛斥了四天之后，斯塔尔宣布他将留职。

sentences.english: When you are studying abroad, the company will maintain your position but stop paying your salary.
sentences.chinese: 在你出国留学期间，我公司为你停薪留职。

sentences.english: Administrations changed, and political parties swapped control of the White House, but Gates remained.
sentences.chinese: 政府换班，政党交替操控白宫，但盖茨继续留职。

definition: to be transferred to another post/to post away
to ask sb to resign from a post
to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to hire (an employee)/to accept (a manuscript) for publication
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
